title: Spaghetti alla Bolognese
description: The authentic meat sauce from Bologna - a rich, slow-cooked ragù with multiple meats, vegetables, and milk, served with tagliatelle (not spaghetti in Bologna, but adapted here).
instructions: Heat olive oil in large heavy pot. Add pancetta and cook until fat renders.
Add finely chopped onion, carrot, and celery (soffritto). Cook over low heat for 15 minutes until soft but not browned.
Increase heat, add ground meats, breaking up with spoon. Cook until browned, about 10 minutes.
Add tomato paste and cook for 2 minutes until darkened. Add red wine, scraping bottom of pot.
Simmer until wine evaporates, about 5 minutes. Add milk and nutmeg, simmer until milk is absorbed.
Add bay leaves and enough beef broth to barely cover meat. Bring to simmer, then reduce heat to lowest setting.
Partially cover and simmer for 3-4 hours, stirring occasionally and adding broth if too dry. Sauce should be thick but moist.
Cook spaghetti in salted boiling water until al dente. Reserve 1 cup pasta water.
Add drained spaghetti to sauce with some pasta water. Toss vigorously over heat until emulsified.
Serve immediately with generous amount of Parmigiano-Reggiano grated over top.
